Introduction

NIK (Japanese: ニック, Korean: 니크) was a Japanese-Korean boy group. The group was formed by the top 11 members selected from the audition program "G-EGG", produced by Yoonhak of the dance and vocal boy group SUPERNOVA.

The members were comprised of former Idol boy band members and current boy band members, including B.I.G member Gunmin, former LC9 and BLK member Hyeonsu, Fumiya, Ryuta, Yunsol, Taehoon, former ZEST & LUCENTE member Kogun, Ryo, former Nu'Bility and LUCENTE member Parkha, Taichi and Hinata.

The origin of the group's name is an acronym for the English words "New", "Inspire" and "Kindle". The group's fandom name is "NIK ISLAND" and the fans are called "NIKEE".

On July 2023, SV Entertainment and ARGS Productions Inc, agencys of the group, announced that the project "G-EGG" would end in July 2023 and the group would eventually disband after the expiration of their contracts.
